Articles.Content:
I've been unable to access wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com

For example, this link:

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Duna

Produces this result

"Sorry! This site is experiencing technical difficulties.

Try waiting a few minutes and reloading.

(Can't contact the database server: Ã¢â‚¬ÂªAccess denied for user 'kerbalsp_wikiu'@'localhost' (using password: YES) (localhost)Ã¢â‚¬Â¬)"

Was working 2 days ago, I think. Has not since Friday night.

i just tried DOJME.com, and according to that the wiki site is up. Tried the site again, still no good.

So, is it really only "just me", or what may be the problem?

- GeorgeG

Edited January 24, 2015 by GeorgeG
Nope. Tried to access the changelog last night and couldn't access it.
We're aware of the issue, sadly it'll have to wait until monday

We're aware of the issue, sadly it'll have to wait until monday

OK, thanks. Good to know what the deal is (or at least when it may be back).

- GeorgeG
What works as a workaround is to search for the URL on Google and use their cached version... (There is a little dropdown next to the URL on the Google results with an option "Cached")
I have been having this same problem, and I thought I was the only one. Good to hear other people are having it as well and it's not just me. I hope it gets back up and running soon!

i just tried DOJME.com, and according to that the wiki site is up. Tried the site again, still no good.

So, is it really only "just me", or what may be the problem?

- GeorgeG

The site is "up" in that the web-server is serving incoming requests - in this case by replying with an error page.

The problem appears to be the link between the front-end (web-page) and back-end (database server); specifically it looks like the login details for the database were changed on the database server and not updated on the frontend. Or vice versa. This is not something a tool such as DOJME.com is programmed to detect.

Sorry! This site is experiencing technical difficulties.

Try waiting a few minutes and reloading.

(Can't contact the database server: Access denied for user 'kerbalsp_wikiu'@'localhost' (using password: YES) (localhost))
Yeah we know Mike, but Squad aren't about at the weekends, they have to see family sometimes

Hi,

i'm just wondering what's wrong with the KSP Wiki in the last few days.

Every time i try to visit the wiki i get a blank page with the following text:

Sorry! This site is experiencing technical difficulties.

Try waiting a few minutes and reloading.

(Can't contact the database server: Access denied for user 'kerbalsp_wikiu'@'localhost' (using password: YES) (localhost))

I haven't found any announcement or other thread regarding this problem lately. So am i the only one experiencing this?

Does anyone have a solution?

Thanks and best regards

Nils

Edit: Ah haven't seen this thread, now my post seems redundant^^

Edited January 26, 2015 by Nils277
Does anybody know why the wiki is down? I haven't been able to connect for a couple of days.
I saw this as well, but I'm not sure why.
The Wiki will be fix as soon as Alex gets a chance, it's still only half past seven in the morning in Mexico city

Yeah we know Mike, but Squad aren't about at the weekends, they have to see family sometimes
I don't know if any of the Squad staff have looked into it at all, or how much work it needs to fix. The internet though doesn't respect evenings and weekends, and I don't think leaving a website down for two days is a good approach.

But I suppose it's for the Squad management to decide.
Huh, well, now I know it's not a problem on my end! That's at least sort of a relief.

Huh, well, now I know it's not a problem on my end! That's at least sort of a relief.

Alex fixed the problem first thing today

Alex fixed the problem first thing today

Yay!

10chr

- - - Updated - - -

What was wrong with it anyway?
I don't know precisely. I told him of the problem and he sent me a message that it was fixed
It's working perfectly.
Huzzah, the wiki is back! Great job, guys!
Close the thread
